div.p: SWORN brothers ( fratres jurati), perſons who, by mutual oath, covenanted to ſhare each others fortune. Formerly, in any notable expedition to invade and conquer an enemy’s country, it was the cuſtom for the more eminent ſoldiers to engage themſelves by reciprocal oaths to ſhare the rewards of their ſervice. This practice gave occaſion to the proverb of ſworn brothers or brethren in iniquity, becauſe of their dividing plunder and ſpoil.
